column1: Riverside Care and Support - King George's Hostel
column6: Single homeless men with a history of sleeping rough in Westminster. Particularly target continuing drug users. Accept men with dogs.
column7: Those with no history of sleeping rough in the City of Westminster. Do not accept those who come for interview under the influence of alcohol or drugs.

column1: Riverside Care and Support - Queen Mary Mental Health Service
column6: Single homeless women with mental health issues requiring medium to high support. Priority given to referrals made by identified Westminster mental health agencies and building-based services.
column7: Women with a history of violence or arson. Women with unaddressed alcohol or drug dependency issues.

column6: Homeless older men with a range of  support needs including: health, mobility, alcohol, mental health and care needs who require on site support to stabilise, engage with treatment services then move on via our housing pathway.
column7: Schedule 1 offenders. Those with a history of violence.

column6: The most entrenched rough sleepers prioritising RS205 clients, couples and those with complex support needs. Must have connection to City of Westminster. Will consider clients with dogs on a case by case basis.
column7: No automatic exclusions. All applications considered on a case by case basis.

column6: Single people with support needs, eg homeless people, people with mental health or substance misuse problems, mothers and babies, care leavers, rough sleepers, young people at risk, refugees. Some projects accept people with both mental health and alcohol/drug problems. Applicants must have a local connection to the London borough where their referral agency is based.
column7: People unable to cope with the level of support provided by the project.
